newsitem.title: GERMANY: Daimler optimistic on China plant deal.
newsitem.headline: Daimler optimistic on China plant deal.

text.p: Daimler-Benz AG said it is confident a disagreement it is having with the Chinese government over a plant to be built there can be resolved and that the project will move ahead.

The Wall Street Journal reported in its electronic edition that Daimler is threatening to abandon a $1 billion joint venture to build minivans in China because it wants to build a single plant, while its partner, state-run Nanfang South China Motor Corp, wants to build two plants.
Since the deal was cut in 1995, China also has changed conditions in the agreement, the journal said.
The Journal quoted Jurgen Hubbert, the Daimler-Benz board member who oversees world-wide passenger-car sales, as saying Mercedes would withdraw from China if the issues could not be resolved.
A Daimler spokesman said on Friday, however, that "the project is not dead," adding that the company had a lot of patience.
